newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-India slides in subdued trade.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-India slides in subdued trade.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts (GDRs) fell in line with the local market, with little buying or selling interest evident in London, traders said.
"The market is being driven by the locals, after a decent recovery in premiums last week," said a trader.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index JCEAI closed down 1.03 points, or 1.66 percent, at 60.93 points, with the premium over the local market at 12.80 percent compared with Friday's 11.76 percent.
The Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index fell 55.85 points, or 1.77 percent, to 3,092.72.
"It feels like a market stuck in a rut," said the trader.
East India Hotels GDRs started trading under the terms of their ex-capitalisation issue of one bonus share for each two already held.

The Capel Korea GDR Index ended down 1.17 points, or 1.77 percent, at 69.47, a premium of 29.64 percent over the local market after the Korea Composite Index fell 18.30 points, or 2.39 percent to 747.43.

The Capel Taiwan GDR Index rose 1.26 points, 1.42 percent, to 89.63, a premium of 89.63 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index rose 59.67 points, or 0.91 percent, to 6,622.61. -- David Chance London newsroom 44 171 542 5887
